title: Calibrating a Candy Machine For a Normal Distribution
question_text: A candy machine dispenses small chocolate candies and claims that $1$ oz is dispensed each time. It is known that the standard deviation of the amount of candy that will be dispensed from this machine is $0.08$ oz and that the amount dispensed follows a normal distribution. We need to calibrate the machine so that the mean amount dispensed will be less than the advertised amount no more than $2\%$ of the time.â€‹ What should we calibrate the mean to be?
